# V8 Serialization Test Fixtures

These fixtures are generated by `testgen/generate.js` using Node.js v8.serialize().

## Generation Environment

- **Node.js**: v22.21.0
- **V8**: 12.4.254.21-node.33
- **Serialization format version**: 15

## File Format

Each fixture consists of two files:

- `<name>.bin` - Raw V8 serialized bytes
- `<name>.json` - Metadata including:
  - `description` - What the fixture tests
  - `nodeVersion` - Node.js version used
  - `v8Version` - V8 engine version
  - `byteLength` - Size of .bin file
  - `hexDump` - Hex representation of bytes
  - `value` - JSON representation of the serialized value

## Regenerating Fixtures

```bash
cd testgen
node generate.js
```

## Wire Format Notes

V8 serialization format structure:

1. **Header**: `0xFF` (version tag) + version number as varint
2. **Type tag**: Single byte identifying the value type
3. **Value data**: Type-specific encoding

Common type tags:
- `'0'` (0x30) - null
- `'_'` (0x5F) - undefined
- `'T'` (0x54) - true
- `'F'` (0x46) - false
- `'I'` (0x49) - Int32 (ZigZag encoded)
- `'U'` (0x55) - Uint32
- `'N'` (0x4E) - Double (IEEE 754 LE)
- `'D'` (0x44) - Date (ms as double)
- `'Z'` (0x5A) - BigInt
- `'"'` (0x22) - One-byte string (Latin1)
- `'c'` (0x63) - Two-byte string (UTF-16LE)
